reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Over all good experience to stay in this hotel. I will recommend to others to use this hotel, if they are looking for good location & good price plus a reason able complementary breakfast.
reviews.title: In general it was very good , in this price range .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very attentive and courteous. Nice rooms with refrigerator and micro.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Courteous Staff, Nice Rooms, Good price.

reviews.text: Chose this motel from an extensive list of properties in or near Owings Mill (Northwest Baltimore). Primarily chose it because of cost and proximity to my business location. Very conveniently located, immediately off I-695. Check in smooth and professional. Found room to be clean, quiet and better than originally expected. All amenities were in good working order, wake up calls on time, room made up shortly after leaving. Directly across street for Hilton (but half the cost). Would highly recommend this facility to those needing a reasonably priced place stay in the northwest area of Baltimore.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.text: I don't expect Ramada hotels to be of the same caliber as the other 4-5 star hotels I've reviewed for this site -that would be absurd- but I don't think that just because a hotel is cheap means it should get a free pass on key points important to travelers. This Ramada hotel on the outskirts of Baltimore met the basics. Was it clean? Yes. Did it feel safe? Yes. Did it have a decent outdoor pool? Yes. Did it have a free, though meager, continental breakfast? Yes. If that's all you care about, then stop reading. However, the bar on budget hotels has been raised by places like the Hampton Inn and the newer Motel 6 locations. For the same price range ($60-$120), the room quality is much higher, with a more upscale feel than what this Ramada had to offer. Quite simply, this hotel felt tired and in need of a renovation. From the dated green bedspreads to the old CRTV and the straining air conditioning unit, the room where I stayed was not exactly a showplace. On the plus side however, this Ramada location continued to offer free toiletries, something which some hotels have cut-back on or even eliminated. Overall, unless you've absolutely got to stay in Pikesville, I can't recommend Ramada Baltimore West. This is a $50 a night hotel charging $80+ prices. For $80+, you can find any number of better places in the greater Baltimore-DC area, particularly if you're using a discount site such as Hotels.com or Priceline.
reviews.title: Not up to the standards of its peer hotels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the Ramada around 9 a.m. after getting into Baltimore on a red eye from California, and although our room wasn't ready, Elizabeth at the front desk found us a room to take a nap in until our room was ready. The room that was available was a smoking room, which was on the parking lot side of the building. These rooms are small and dark, and there was litter all around outside -- very depressing. The front desk called us when our room was ready -- a larger, cleaner, brighter room on the courtyard side of the building. It was a completely different experience. We appreciated the use of a room while ours was being made up, but rooms on this side of the property should be AVOIDED AT ALL COST. That said, the front desk couldn't have been more accommodating and helpful, and the free breakfast looked adequate. This is a budget property and a good value if the unpleasant smoking rooms are avoided.
reviews.title: Stay in a room on the courtyard side

reviews.text: This hotel has all of the amenities that a business traveler wants, reasonable rates and a friendly, courteous staff.
reviews.title: This hotel has all of the amenities that a business traveler wants, reasonable rates and a friendly, courteous staff.

reviews.text: Rooms include a small refrigerator, microwave oven and in-room coffee. Guests may have a free breakfast at the hotel.
reviews.title: Best Place to stay in and around this area

reviews.text: The hotel has an outdoor swimming pool and an exercise room.
reviews.title: Worth every penny!!

reviews.text: All of the hotel staff including housekeepers and desk clerks are friendly and courteous.
reviews.title: Great Location-Great Price, Good Hotel

reviews.text: The rooms are neat, clean and well-kept.
reviews.title: What a dump!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for the Preakness weekend and while we didn't have any issues personally, there seemed to be a lot of shady people around this area and the hotel. The place is incredibly dated and needs a massive facelift. We checked for bed bugs and didn't see any and the place appeared to be "clean" but it was old and worn. I did notice colonies of ants all along the walkway outside the room and some even inside our room door. They could use an exterminator. The morning of the second day, friends of ours that were also staying at the hotel came out to find that their car had nearly been stolen. They had mistakenly left their car unlocked and someone had gone in and cut some wires in the steering column to try to get it started. After that we moved our cars in front of the building. However, after coming home I found out that someone had been murdered in the parking lot right in front of the hotel just a few days before we got there. The location is ok, it's right off the beltway and for the race it was ok because it was as close as we could get although the taxi guys left us high and dry after the race after promising to pick us up, they returned but took others back instead. While we turned down the cleaning folks to turn over our rooms since we prefer to not have anyone in our rooms when we stay somewhere, it seemed to take them all day/night to clean the small amount of rooms that they had to clean. They also just stared at us most of the time. Very strange. I'd never stay here again. Pay more, stay in Inner Harbor or in another suburb.
reviews.title: Stay Elsewhere, Shady Area, Shady People Around

reviews.text: This place is definitely not worth the money. The rooms are in desperate need of renovations and the carpet looks as if it will give your feet an infection. The linens on the beds seemed old and worn and the curtains would not close all the way. The overall landscape and upkeep seems neglected and uncared for by management and the owners. The guests on my row were loud and there seems to be no security there to patrol and maintain control of rowdy guests. Come to find out someone was killed there the night before I stayed there and yet there was no additional security. I will make sure that I never stay at this place again. I normally don't leave negative reviews, but people need to know what they are getting before they spend their hard earned money on it.
reviews.title: Not Worth The Money

reviews.text: Do not stay at this place if you have any class. The little clerk was rude and ignorant. Very unprofessional and our of her element as far as customer service goes. Her name was something wilson. The breakfast left much to be desired. The drink dispenser hsss
reviews.title: What a Dump.

reviews.text: purchase food elsewhere. Beware!
reviews.title: Quite Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent front desk service. Couldn't work TV & they came within 3 minutes to show us.
reviews.title: What a terrific stay and really good value at Ramada Pikesville, Md.

reviews.text: The free breakfast was very good, plentiful and with an attendant present. The rooms were clean, large and most comfortable. It was a very pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Great customer service -- great rates -- good, clean room with very comfy beds!

reviews.text: Couple from Long Island, NY.
reviews.title: Extremely Disappointed

reviews.text: My family and I frequently visit the Virginia, Maryland, NJ and NY areas and we try to stay at Ramadas whenever we can because of the inexpensive rates of the rooms, the cleanliness of the rooms and the excellent overall customer service. The Ramada in Pikesville is no exception -- I find their staff very willing to give a good rate and quick to respond to any requests (i.e., additional towels or coffee). The beds are very comfortable, the rooms nice and quiet, and it's very close to Target, Dunkin Donuts and other shops and stores we often need to visit.
reviews.title: Peaceful

reviews.text: Our first night, Friday, August 13, 2010, we were unable to sleep due to the loud conversations at the gazebo which woke us up around 2:30 AM. After approximately an hour of trying to go back to sleep, I called and reported it to the front desk. The loud conversations ended within a few minutes, but, resurfaced at approximately 6:30 AM. Once again, it was reported to the front desk, however, nothing was done. The loud conversations at the gazebo continued. Consequently, my cousin and I were not able to get any sleep Friday night. Then at approximately 7:30 AM, I called the front desk again to request a room change. The man who answered the phone did not speak English well, and therefore, hung up on me. This was rude. Needless to say, I was extremely offended. If he could not understand what I was trying to communicate, he could have asked the person in the background for assistance rather than hanging up on a customer. Better still, maybe he should not be answering the phone until he is proficient with the English language. This is a sure way to lose customers. Moreover, we when visited the front desk Saturday morning to request a room change, the person operating the front desk, LaShonda, displayed a nasty attitude and was extremely rude. She was curt and acted as though my complaint had no merit and if it did, she did not care. We were re-assigned to another room; however, the room was filled with smoke. Another room was assigned to us at approximately 2 PM only to discover that it too was smoked filled. Upon our arrival back to the Ramada Inn at approximately 8 PM, we were told that the females who were responsible for disturbing our sleep were escorted off of the property. Consequently, my cousin and I had a restful night of sleep on Saturday. Perhaps they should have been escorted off of the property Friday night. Moreover, it would help to have LaShonda attend public relations classes, so that she will know how to address customer concerns in a professional way. Additionally, I would like to suggest that it may help to charge a fee for smoking in designated non-smoking rooms, thus ensuring that customers honor the no smoking policy. This could be an agreement added to the room reservation bill and/or contract. Moreover, it may also help to close down access to the gazebo at a reasonable hour, so not to interfere with other's rest. Please know that we, my cousin and I, were extremely displeased with our visit to the Ramada Baltimore West, Pikesville location and would NOT recommend this location to anyone.
reviews.title: Dirty, Nasty and Dangerous
